intro: Biscutella apula f. columnae, commonly known as the columnar biscutella, is a rare and distinctive plant species characterized by its unique columnar growth form. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae and is native to specific regions in southern Europe. The plant features small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale purple, and its leaves are narrow and linear. It thrives in rocky or limestone soils and is often found in alpine or subalpine environments. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species.
